metadata.title: 5229-1 -- Firefox vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Multiple security issues were discovered in Firefox. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service, spoof the browser UI, bypass security restrictions, obtain sensitive information across domains, or execute arbitrary code.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo ua fix USN-5229-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  firefox-locale-nl - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 firefox-locale-nn - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 firefox-locale-ne - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 firefox-locale-nb - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 firefox-locale-fa - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 firefox-locale-fi - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 firefox-locale-fr - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 firefox-locale-fy -
